heading: ***HIGH WIND WARNINGS FROM THE GREEN MOUNTAINS WEST, AND WIND ADVISORIES EAST THROUGH 1 PM IN NY, CENTRAL AND NORTHERN VT, EVENING IN SOUTHERN VT, NH, AND MA, INTO SATURDAY MORNING IN NORTHERN NH***Today
text: Rain, mixing or changing to snow showers from west to east, starting in the Adirondacks, then the Green Mountains, lowering to the valleys north, while rain tapers off south. Highs in the upper 40s and 50s, falling west to east. Winds from the south 15 to 30 mph, gusting 40 to 55 mph, shifting to the west and decreasing.

heading: Tonight
text: Snow tapering to snow showers north, more likely over the higher terrain, up to an inch. Becoming partly cloudy south. Lows in the teens, near 10 over higher terrain north, to the low 20s south. West winds becoming northwest 10 to 20 mph, gusting 35 to 45 mph.

heading: Saturday
text: Mostly sunny south. Variable clouds and sun north, giving way to afternoon clouds, and a rising chance of snow in NY late. Highs from the mid 20s north, to the mid 30s south. Northwest winds 10 to 15 mph, gusting to 35 mph, up to 45 mph east of the Greens, turning to the south less than 10 mph, gusting to 25 mph from the Champlain Valley west.
